title: ‘Mostly positive, but can be quite challenging at times.’
pros: Relatively high base wage for the position, reliable full-time work with fairly consistent shift times, and a mostly supportive culture. Good perks (high discount on your home gas/electricity bills for yourself and your family/friends).
cons: A constantly changing workplace and a virtually schizophrenic commitment to changing and updating procedures and protocols. Just as you get used to one way of doing things, it's time to unlearn it all and start over.

title: ‘Friendly and motivating place to work with great opertunities.’
pros: The culture and the management style are great to work in. The environment allows for effective career progression and is very inclusive.
cons: Can be a bit difficult working on contentious issues within the community. Can also get lost in the large number of employees.

title: ‘Great employer and working relationships, but be ready to work hard’
pros: Very progressive values align with mine; remarkable employee-friendly policies like working from home, casual dress, etc. Supportive, professional colleagues keep me going through stressful times. Amazing office environment.
cons: Frequent restructuring and loss of people results in gaps in knowledge and processes and more work for those left behind. Extremely strict hot desk ('smarter working') policy is counterproductive- everyone is constantly looking for desks to work at throughout the day.

title: ‘Great team, great work-life balance, lifelong friends, so happy I got to be apart of the amazing team at AGL’
pros: Great team environment with a lot of support and on the job training. I have made some life long friends from working at AGL and was very sad to leave. The managers, even the centre manager knew most people's name and made the effort to get to know their staff and support them in everything.
cons: You do have to meet targets but the rewards are worth it. If you don't achieve them they take the time to train you in the areas you are struggling with.

title: ‘9 good years. Last 6month not great.’
pros: The people are great. It is a fun environment and if you are managed by a great leader then you will be able to develop yourself & your Career.
cons: There can be Silos, different business units have their own agenda. I have experience different area working on the same project. Management from leaders within different areas did not align with company values. It was surprising that some managers survived & were able to hide their poor leadership & ppl management skills.

title: ‘Good money, mixed Values, Bad People Skills’
pros: AGL has a decent salary and benefits like cheaper electricity and gas. Some of the values they stand for like diversity aligned with mine and if you work hard the bonuses are great. Team culture when initially starting is great.
cons: Flexibility with working arrangements if wanting to take a step back due to personal circumstances or study. High pressure to achieve results with unrealistic expectations. Customers are not at the centre of this organisations nor are customers friendly. I felt the environment very mixed and sometimes forced.

title: ‘Constantly changing work environment which becoming less personable.’
pros: The move towards flexible working is a plus, and the modern facilities in Melbourne (and Sydney in 2 years time) are real positives.
cons: The recent change in CEO (who appears to have been brought in as an agent for sweeping change) is impacting on culture, with 20% OPEX reductions (read job cuts) promised to the board.  The old middle management team is responding, but is not really up to the job of such major change.

title: ‘Superb orgnisation to work with.’
pros: Great work culture, amasing people and superb office infrastucture located above southern cross.
cons: AGL believes in its people, process also need a bit more stringent to make daily business run smooth.

title: ‘Great company that truly supported diversity and flexibility with employees’
pros: Supportive environment that helped me grow and diversify my career.  Supported flexible working conditions that allowed me to live and work in separate states.
cons: The industry is changing very quickly and requires the business to change quickly, this was constantly changing the shape of the workforce and the skills and structure required to support that workforce

title: ‘I worked as a contractor for 1 year and this is probably the best company I've worked for in terms of professionalism, work-life balance and management. I was working with the brightest people I've worked with and felt like I was part of a team instead of’
pros: Great work life balance, office space, people, management, culture of inclusion and diversity.
cons: If I was a permanent employee, I would probably be wondering on how I can grow vertically and horizontally. Not a clear enough growth plan

title: ‘Initially a great culture supported by management that had a clear focus. However, recent changes in management have resulted in a lack of direction and confusion.’
pros: Initially a very good culture.  Recruitment places a heavy emphasis on the candidate's character.
cons: Multiple agendas and a dynamic market have resulted in frequent and sudden changes of direction.  This has led to confusion and frequently inadequate timeframes to deliver quality.  Prioritisation of projects has also been a challenge, with some low value projects securing heavy resource allocation.

title: ‘Don't apply if you want development, understanding and to actually help people.’
pros: The pay was good for what you are doing. The people that you work with are usually pretty fantastic too. That is about it
cons: It is all about the money. There is little to no flexibility and it doesn't account for the individual - we are all just numbers. While they say it is a customer service based industry, it is nothing more than sales, sale, sales.

title: ‘Fast paced, hard work, rewarding environment’
pros: A company that really cares about its employees. Staff engagement is one of the most important things to AGL and they always endevour for you to both be rewarded and feel appreciated for your work
cons: The job it self can be quite emotionally draining. It is a fast paced environment which requires a thick skin at times due to the type of enquiries you can receive. There is also a high focus on KPIs

title: ‘Some positives and negatives. Hoping we can focus on what matters and double down for the long-haul; rather than whatever cause is trending and will get our CEO's good corporate 'feels'. ’
pros: Work life balance is sound. AGL have worked hard to offer a number of employee benefits to retain personnel.
cons:
Senior and middle management oscillating between business models every two years to present the illusion of needed and meaningful change.

Management are not well versed in articulating a coherent and substantive vision for many in AGL's employ to get in behind and buy into. 

Senior Management seems to focus on out-performing all feel-good  -quasi-corporate / social issues; rather than well laid out business structures and flows, formed under a vision that will take AGL to the agile space it will need to occupy in the mid 2020's when peaking demand will be at its highest.

title: ‘Customer Service’
pros: Salary is decent, it's fairly consistent work in terms of hours, the staff are great to work with and they're always looking at different ways to make things fresh and new. They constantly run competitions, have bi-annual awards nights, the parties are awesome.
cons: The customers can be really difficult and there's a strong expectation to meet sales every month.

title: ‘The culture encourages an open mind, intuition and to be supportive to colleagues.’
pros: Flexible working, friendly colleagues, and supportive managers that encourage autonomy and innovation. Great building in Sydney, centrally located. Opportunity for career development but need to push your own development.
cons: Some times long hours, fast paced so mental exhaustion occurs at the end of the day.

title: ‘Between politics, overly complex procedures and lack of management support, I was sapped of Energy. Every pun intended.’
pros:
> Mature HR policies
> Great physical work environment
cons:
> Overly complicated processes given the simplicity of its structure
> HR policies are not applied equally
> Empathy is a learned characteristic amongst top finance managers
> Career development is based on being liked rather than good/ great performance
> Very political internal environment
> At that time, high levels of organisational inertia

title: ‘Best workplace I've ever experienced’
pros: Work/Life balance is really emphasised and encouraged, great place for those with families and in fact most of the people I work with have families and have one day a week to work from home. There's a big focus on output as a measure instead of face-time in the office.
cons: It's a slower pace than I'm used to and I constantly feel like I should be doing more, which is very much a personal thing and not on AGL

title: ‘Great work life balance’
pros:
Flexibility and work life balance are second to none. I’m still amazed by how amazing AGL when it comes to flexible work options. 
Executive leadership team are wonderful.
cons: Limited opportunities for career progression. Middle management struggle with leadership.

title: ‘Great people and great place to work.’
job_title: GM Commercial Development & Head Of Upstream Gas Finance
pros: The only genuine values-driven organisation I've ever worked for. Senior management comes and goes, but the culture remains strong and most employees are engaged.
cons: Organisation faces significant challenges on many fronts as gas and electricity markets deal with disruptive technologies and new entrants over every next decade.
location: North Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

title: ‘Great place to work if you like the environment where you are encouraged to 'Play the Game' and enjoy lots of Corporate Speak & Meetings’
pros: Supportive company who actively harnesses and develops talent and has a good work/life balance.
cons: Very Leftist \"Participation Award\" environment and are very quick to adopt the latest flavor of the month in the Corporate world, lots of Window Dressing that looks good in a Brochure but is actively forced upon staff and anyone who does not agree or is not supportive of the latest Community, Environment or Social agenda initiative is somewhat frowned upon.

title: ‘It was good’
pros: Environment Was good
cons: Everyday is a new day

title: ‘A great place to work if you want drive change and make an impact.’
pros: Great people, great environment. Good opportunity to work on a range of different projects.
cons: Not exactly fast. Some processes were a little dated, however they were in the process of moving to agile.

title: ‘A highly political company, with careful strategic use of the branding & marketing teams to appear authentic. ’
pros: D&I, specifically family & domestic issues, valuable education & training, on site. Considerable funding was provided.
cons: Ongoing strong focus on casual employment, including people employed full time for up to 8 years. Also, a culture had developed that thrived on excessive & ongoing kaos, driven by Corporate senior management KPI’s.

title: ‘Everything you do and say is monitored to the extreme - perform perfectly and get perfect sales every month and you will do well - otherwise you will be replaced by someone in the Philippines’
pros: If you can jump through the hoops they set up you will be well rewarded with treats ... just ensure you keep performing
cons: Treated like a number in a call centre that might as well have a revolving door on the front of the building.

title: ‘If the jobs right it would be a great place to work.’
pros: Great place to work with great people, workplaces and technology.
cons: Leadership can be poor based on the area. Board and CEO have great vision however direct reports are of varying capabilities but those who have been there a while are very poor.

title: ‘The working enviroment was warm, friendly and approachable. I'd be happy to go back there to work if the right role came up withing Marketing.’
pros: Very friendly environment to work within
cons: Some marketing/business activity was not managed end to end so by the time we'd reach a solution for implementation we'd realised the business had not addressed the whole customer experience and lots of gaps were found.

title: ‘Under Construction - Check back in FY20’
pros: Pay is high. Focus on women in IT. Full of talented people. Discounted Energy Bills.
cons: Always looking to implement the next shiny new technology with no thought or effort on how to integrate with last month's projects. Strategy on the fly. So much going on that projects can't gain access to a clear schedule of change - collisions everywhere. Latest restructure has angered the talent pool and good people are now leaving to go elsewhere. Technical debt is reaching critical levels.

title: ‘Making the move to apply at AGL was a great decision I do noy regret 3 years on’
pros: Great culture, supportive environment, salary of a high standard
cons: The industry itself can be challenging to work in at times

title: ‘Developing and fulfilling’
pros:
Good building
Great team members
cons: Tough opportunities to progress

title: ‘Awful, couldn't wait to leave’
pros: Good training, reasonable office environment
cons: Pressured into achieving kpi's where the number of calls taken (in call centre), was more important than good service and accuracy

title: ‘Ok for someone who is mentally strong and just wants to do a job and pay the bills. ’
pros: Newly renovated office
cons: Unrealistic sales targets and KPIs. Bad leadership skills.

title: ‘Delivering quality outcomes comes with the territory.’
pros: Great office environment and location. Great teams.
cons: With a focus on an Agile delivery utilising SAFe - the new framework is not the easiest to get \"buy-in\" across all tiers of the business.

title: ‘Has potential’
pros: Work life balance and friendly people
cons: Outsourcing and not technologically advanced

title: ‘Excellent place to work ’
pros: The support and understanding of management
cons: Seperating personal life from work at the time

title: ‘Great company’
pros: Great people good culture
cons: Long hours a lot of travel some good leaders some bad depends on who you get

title: ‘Good place and genuine people work balance cup’
pros: Positive culture and people
cons: Beaucracy and not as nimble  as similar placed organizations

title: ‘Enjoyable’
pros: Great people and environment
cons: Was only a contractor there so hard to say

title: ‘Great team with a lot of potential.’
pros: Good company and CEO with a vision.
cons: Old team members wanted to do their own way.

title: ‘Could have been better ’
pros: Location was great , very convenient
cons: The management was caught up in the politics which reflected on the culture

title: ‘Good enviorment well paid’
pros: Brand new building
cons: KPI's reduce almost un achievable

title: ‘Micro management at micro level.’
pros: Great Xmas parties and award nights.
cons: Doing the right thing by the customer and the business at the same time.

title: ‘Would have been better if I was related or a friend of management’
job_title: Power Factor Correction Specialist Really A TA
pros: Working to suit family life
cons: Low pay don't listen to new ideas poor communication poor safety

title: ‘Standard call center experience. Draining and pointless.’
pros: Good Salary, Job security, Good perks, Great Amenities
cons: Angry customers = negative atmosphere, Self motivation, no social aspect.

title: ‘Poor support from management.’
pros: Lovey colleagues, great location
cons: Very sales focussed,

title: ‘I enjoy working at AGL as they always have plenty of opportunities and projects to be a part of.’
pros: Great smarter working office
cons: Hiring the wrong people in some IT roles

title: ‘Superb place to work’
pros: Fatastic work environment.
cons: Huge amount of work within a limited period of time

title: ‘Great company with good people & would work there again.’
pros: Committed to diversity & work/life balance.
cons: Moving to being an energy tech company and is challenging how it does business.

title: ‘Overall have enjoyed majority of time employed.’
pros: Good benefits and working environment.
cons: Minimal career opportunities in Adelaide unfortunately.

title: ‘Anguish.’
pros: The training was thorough.
cons: They treat call centre staff like filth. They make it impossible to have a genuine sick day. They REFUSE to let you take a proper holiday. You are made to come in. It is impossible to travel.

title: ‘Love the digital team and its people’
pros: Culture and work life balance
cons: Too many things at a time.

title: ‘I did useful work which was appreciated.’
pros: Good people.  Inclusive attitudes.  Great address.
cons: Top down management structure.

title: ‘Terrible’
pros: The pay was okay. Location was okay
cons: Customers treat you like garbage and the performance expections were unrealistic

title: ‘Great money but not worth the stress’
pros: Great salary, options for commissions and bonuses, engaging workplace.
cons: Inability to be flexible with hours, great intolerance to staff needing sick leave, incredibly high stress environment, lack of support from management, lack of training past the initial stages of induction, inability to manage stressed staff properly, not very flexible with annual leave.

title: ‘Poor management who can't honor agreements’
pros: Benefits such as cheaper electricity, zoo passes etc.
cons: No longer customer focused, they only care about sales now. No longer willing to help out staff with outside family and study commitments.

title: ‘Enjoyed delivering real value to both AGL and Customers.’
pros: Great people and culture. Like a family.
cons: Restructured regularly, so frequent challenges.

title: ‘Lots of shortcuts taken and lots of legacy ’
pros:
Sparkling water taps
new offices and facilities
cons:
Old school management - do as i say not as i do
not safe to speak up
high turnover 
consistent restructuring
lack of strategy
massive amount of politics for such a small organisation

title: ‘A great experience with fond memories’
pros: State of the art office, highly flexible working hours, great attitude  across staff to share information and help
cons: Lack of strategic orientation, limited career progression,

title: ‘Thankful for the opportunity ’
pros: Lots of opportunities and great people to work with.
cons: Restructures are constant

title: ‘It's a good time to be part of AGL’
pros: Great future, office environment
cons: Fast growth, too many changes

title: ‘The management will drain the life out of you with unrealistic expectations. ’
pros: Work colleagues, onsite parking
cons:
Qualities such as empathy, caring and resilience is not what this company supports. Their main focus is the AHT and keeping it low whilst  dealing with disgruntled customers, as well as fixing things as they’re calling in for the 10th time on the same day. You must also meet unrealistic sales targets and you will be treated like a robot. 
Working for this company should not be a long term goal for anyone.

title: ‘Workplace And Support Services’
pros:
Work Life Balance. Support network and 
Benefits
cons: Staff expectations re service delivery

title: ‘Good sense of camaraderie and purpose.’
pros: Great opportunity for career advancement, Focus on ensuring employees are not burnt out and delivering whilst being able to enjoy their personal lives. Pay is above average.
cons: Politics can be cumbersome at times.

title: ‘It was a good experience and learnt soo much over my apprenticeship.’
pros: Roster until 15th of July 2019
cons: Fault finding, working to a deadline

title: ‘The dream job I never knew I wanted.’
pros: Very much a team environment.
cons: Dealing with external third party businesses.

title: ‘Great learning and I achieved a lot with a great team’
pros: My boss. His boss. The work we did and what I achieved

title: ‘Initially amazing, somewhat lacking now.’
pros: Staff benefits and perks, the people you work with.

title: ‘The company is not prepared to stand by its employees under its new CEO’

title: ‘Great opportunity as a result of change and strong values’
pros: Opportunities, R&R, great team inclusion

title: ‘Too many levels of management and not enough workers.’

title: ‘It is such a respectful working environment, people collaborate share knowledge and provide support to each other.’
pros: Relaxed friendly collaborative environment, quick to get laptop and access to systems.
cons: Just locating who does what in the organisation.

title: ‘Good pay but ultimately much happier elsewhere’
pros: Salary & work/life balance
cons: Communication from the top and leadership culture is extremely poor.

title: ‘Overall a good a good company to work with.’
pros: New building,gatherings,Awards nights
cons: Getting incentive as they cancel the whole incentive if you have one unplanned leave which is not good.

title: ‘Worked on turbine rebuilds, superintended contractors during outages’
pros: i had a diverse workload working on many different pieces of equipment
cons: Not getting involved in the employee politics

title: ‘Would recommend ’
pros: Team culture. Benefits outside of salary
cons: Upper Management. Lack of opportunities outside of Sydney and Melbourne if you want to progress.

title: ‘Wasted 10 years only to be told they didn't want mine or anyone else who had been there more than 5 years experience’
pros: Technology and beautiful new building, and the Xmas party was always good
cons: Mass redundancy , mass offshoring of all roles, there is now a knowledge deficit due to the redundancy

title: ‘Great Culture, Great People and Diverse Employees’
pros: Good Culture  and Workplace
cons: Workloads at times and challenges arising form that

title: ‘Amazing work place’
pros: Flexible hours, awesome environment, fantastic people and an amazing new building!
cons: Annual leave books are super fast so you have to be in quick!

title: ‘Temping at AGL’
pros: Friendly colleagues and the opportunities to interact with a number of different people.
cons: As a temp you have lots to learn in a short amount of time, but this was a positive challenge!

title: ‘Wonderful company to work for, they hire amazing people and often promote from within.’
pros: Fringe benefits from working for a corporate
cons: Understanding the landscape of such a large organisation

title: ‘Exciting place with great support/culture and opportunities to grow’
pros: Great culture.  Innovative.  Good direction. Opportunities.
cons: The industry itself is complex and regulatory impeded.

title: ‘Great’

cons: No challenges just work hard

title: ‘They paid well. ’

cons: The management team are focused on profit not people.

title: ‘Recruitment was un-transparent and failed to set me up for success’
pros: The diversity of environment
cons: Strategies and systems over complicated

title: ‘Treats you as just a number’
pros: Highly paid for what it was
cons: Treated as nothing more than a number. Had to book leave at least 6-9 months in advance and then still couldn't get leave half the time.

title: ‘A company that appears to be losing its way’
pros:
There are pockets of potential for exciting and fulfilling work
Work life balance is a genuine focus
There are good people there
cons:
Current management has no genuine long term strategic vision
Culture at the middle and top is not conducive to long term value
Management of challenges is tactical rather than strategic

title: ‘Impossible KPI's’
pros: Based above southern cross station
cons: No available leave, demanding managers.

title: ‘Good money but you need to be very resiliant’
pros: Excellent pay but you need to be resilient
cons: Difficult customer's, bad shifts minimal support

title: ‘Promised a lot, delivered little!’
pros: Process and procedures, structure. Extensive training.
cons: Poor local support, admin support offshore,poor customer care, poor company perception.

title: ‘A company with leadership as old as the coal they burn.’
pros: The breadth of the work.
cons: Poor leadership and no desire to listen to new ideas.

title: ‘Good company but poor managers’
pros: The company name and good mix of people working there.
cons:
Poor people managers

title: ‘Management were egoistical’
pros: Safety conscious.

title: ‘Great place to work and shine.’
pros: Embracing change and innovation - want to change.
cons: Process and hierarchy orientated - which can stifle change and innovation.

title: ‘Amazing team of people, would highly recommend it! ’
pros: Being able to work with an incredible team of engineers and management was fantastic. People really wanted to help others out and everyone was very inclusive.
cons: No challenges that I experienced. Leaving to go overseas was an extremely hard decision as I could have stayed with this company forever!

title: ‘Good people but poor level of true happiness’
pros: The people who work here are all really welcoming and want everyone to feel part of the team. Great team environment.
cons: They say they are great flexibility in work arrangements but they really don't. If you get sick you shouldn't work here or you'll probably end up being made to feel even worse.

title: ‘Out of 20 different work places, this is the one I would never return too.’
pros: Nice new offices, good drinks.
cons: Too many people walking around doing nothing, while you are working your fingers off.

title: ‘Wouldn’t recommend ’
pros: Decent starting wages and good colleagues
cons:
They didn’t express how much importance there would be on making sales etc during interview.
Were very uncaring about any personal leave that was taken and would pressure you to come in even when unwell. 
Overall a very negative environment with very high turnover!

title: ‘Brillitant work life balance’
pros: Excellent team culture and a good work life balance
cons: Process maps and adherence to the knowledge management system.

title: ‘Decent pay, nice working environment and acceptable culture’
pros: Good culture and a nice working environment
cons: Understanding what my role is going to be and knowing where I need to advance myself

title: ‘For a large organisation AGL unfortunately operates years behind other large organisations. If there was clearer direction and buy in from the organisation it would be a great place to work. ’
pros: The people are very welcoming when you start.
cons: Management challenges, there have been countless restructures with no clear direction. Flexible working is available for those with supportive managers only.

title: ‘Average, I would have stayed with better wage and closer to home.’
pros: Made some great friends
cons: Constant management changes and no way to negotiate a better salary even with years of experience and more qualifications then others.

title: ‘Easily the best company that I have worked for.’
pros: Highly supportive of parents returning to the workplace.
cons: Frequent restructuring meant that strategic plans and direction went through a lot of change.

title: ‘Overall AGL was a good company to work for.’
pros: Company with good values and good work life balance.
cons: Middle  and top heavy management. Career progression can be a challenge.

title: ‘Great to use your skills but don't expect loyalty from upper management who will fire you when they are done with you.’

title: ‘Would like to have seen more actions taken & less words.’
pros: The amazing people I have had the opportunity to work with.
cons: The office politics and unfair work life balance.

title: ‘Enjoyable working experience.’
pros: Great company to work for.
cons: None that I can recall.

title: ‘Look forward to go to work on Mondays’

cons: Getting things moving

title: ‘A very frustrating but worthwhile learning experience.’
pros: Great people with quite clever and innovative ideas. Lots of untapped potential
cons: Getting ideas off the ground extremely difficult, management is reticent to commit resources to doing things properly so there is a spaghetti mess of years of accumulated band-aid solutions. Extremely change resistant culture.

title: ‘Good pay, soul crushing experience’
pros: The company plays above average rate, and they provide flexible working conditions
cons: It depends on the asset where you work. This place is definitely all about who you know, and not what you know. People are afraid to speak up as repercussions usually follow. The management lacks diversity of experience, most have been at one place entire career. Business practices are often 20 to 30 years behind trend.

title: ‘Terrible, 10 years experience in the industry overlooked’

title: ‘This was a good company which has gone downhill.’

title: ‘Lots of good things to enjoy at agl, and like any big business has it challenges.’

title: ‘Enjoyed the experience there for the first few years but things changed and everything was not the same’

title: ‘I am actively looking for work as I believe work life balance is important and AGL does not prioritise this for its call centre workers.’

title: ‘Great company to work for.’

title: ‘Good pay, but unrealistic expectations’

title: ‘Best company and role I've ever had’
pros: Flexibile work arrangements. Incentive bonuses for high performance. Great offices, good technology, opportunities to learn
cons: Removing legacy systems and processes

title: ‘They need to be unfront about sales, do not tell new staff after training that if they do not sell 1 plan a day you are out, tell them during the recruitment process., managers are not good at their jobs as well ’
pros: Staff discounts, good facilities
cons: Poor systems, unachievable goals

title: ‘Super Excellent!’
pros: Very good company to work for.
cons: Work load increased due to competitive market.

title: ‘Awesome!’
pros: Technical growth opportunities
cons: Many.. but AGL is great at solving them!

title: ‘A great company to work with.’
pros: Flexibility
cons: Travel distance

title: ‘Has a great potential to be good workplace but is let down with a toxic work environment, backstabbing and lacks leadership from management’
pros: Flexible work arrangements
cons: Constant restructures, not great leadership from management

title: ‘Great to work for a leader in its field but management team could have been more inspiring.’
pros: Good recognition and reward for good performance. Frequently at the forefront in the industry in comparison to competitors.
cons: Sometimes, marketing activities did not have clear objectives. Always a flurry of work and constant change made it hard to keep up and also balance work life.

title: ‘Tiring’
pros: People band together and look after each other
cons: Short stuffed, not engaging

title: ‘Wasn’t a pleasant experience so wouldn’t recommend to anyone.’
pros: There was nothing good I can mention here.
cons: Management doesn’t know what they want and particularly I had a bad experience because when they hired me, I thought there would be lot of work but it was opposite when I joined and straight after a month, they retrenched me.

title: ‘And is a great company to work for’
pros: Very team focused
cons: The kpi

title: ‘Working in AGL is like working as in \"family\" business’
pros: Excellent environment $ team work
cons: Handling aggressive customer

title: ‘A good employer if you like to be micromanaged and enduring insatiable management’
pros:
- Professional environment
- close to public transport 
- Ability to make commission
cons:
- Autocratic management structure 
- Strange identity politics 
- Not very environmentally conscious

title: ‘An enjoyable and thoughtful company to work for.’
pros:
Beautiful office environment. 
Fantastic management support.
cons: Call centre work- frustrated customers

title: ‘Would rather work at maccas, better management.’
pros: People who aren't leaders or higher up are very lovely, sometimes they will offer free lunch, however this is normally to make a \"bad situation\" better.
cons: Very poor management, will often sweeten up mistakes or errors with treats, be it free lunch or longer breaks.  Moving up the ladder really comes down to how well you are at sucking up. Would prefer to be a shift manager at Mcdonalds again, better scheme and vision there.

title: ‘In the right team great things happened ’
pros: Great office convenient location
cons: Fast paced always changing management changing often

title: ‘Glad I left’
pros: Lovely environment and staff discount on energy
cons: Mobbing was tolerated. Didn't walk the walk on supporting womens career progression.

title: ‘It's safe but stressful.’
pros: Pays ok. Perks are good.
cons: The inability to stand up for yourself on difficult calls, and the head games.

title: ‘AGL - progressive culture and great people.’
pros: Progressive culture. Recognition at individual and team level.  Employee Communications and Change Management processes are excellent.
cons: ERP functionality not maximised.
location: North Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

title: ‘I loved AGL’
pros: Colleagues, smaller management
cons: Micro managing, stress within the workplace

title: ‘Achieve five star excellence by living the values.’
pros: Promotion from within, provided the tools needed for success, encouraged to excel.
cons: The biggest challenge with this company was narrowing down my career path because so many opportunities were available.

title: ‘Horrible experience but the pay was good. This company makes you appreciate the next job you get!’
pros: Pay was suitable.  If it wasn't for the pay I wouldn't have stayed working there
cons: Micro management with unachievable targets

title: ‘Good for experience, you’ll always be looking for the next move though. ’
pros: Pay well and plenty of training for product knowledge.
cons: High pressure leadership. Always under the microscope. Micromanagement. Poor soft skills from management to the point that even they look for greener pastures.

title: ‘Awesome place to work in, great perks. But move to Melbourne for better career development. ’
pros: Fun environment to work with. It is lively call center.
cons: Customers... same issues day in day out. If you're based in Adelaide you don't have room to move up too much. But you can transfer to Melbourne easily.

title: ‘The management or starategy of the whole company is just not up to the standard.’
pros: The culture is very good and workplace environment is great.
cons:
There is no recognition in the company no matter what you do. 

The management is the worst that I have come across. 

Company strategy is not laid out properly

title: ‘Listening to complaints all day’
pros: There is some  great people working there
cons: Not able to leave your desk every minute of the day is recorded

title: ‘Would not recommend to a friend’
pros: The best thing is the people.
cons: Very political and it's all about who you are seen with - doesn't matter if you don't perform.

title: ‘Underwhelming at best. ’
pros: Great work life balance and ability to work remotely at times that work best for you.
cons: Lots of lip service from senior managers. Very political and everyone is in it for themselves. I’ve never seen direct reports of the C level throw their teams under the bus like they do at AGL. No accountability at that level. Quick to point the finger and play the blame game.

title: ‘Culture changed for the worse’
pros: Flexible working environment
cons: People and team changes

title: ‘Great for a contractor!’
pros: Great location, fantastic office facilities, great work-life-balance
cons: Management can be underwhelming at times... lacking direction, vision and execution of a genuine plan.

title: ‘Could have been great if they listened to SME's and had integrity’
pros: My role wasn't well defined and there was opportunity to design the role.
cons: Management did have the right knowledge in this area to understand the problem and because they reported things were getting address (which they weren't) anyone telling them it wasn't fixed wasn't welcome.

title: ‘Lack of senior management capability and ability to speak out’
pros: Constant change, thus opportunities exist
cons: Lack of leadership / management capabilities

title: ‘Awesome ’
pros: Culture and support, clear expectations
cons:
High standards expected
Difficult to get flexible working

title: ‘VERY GOOD PLACE TO WORK. HAVE TO DELIVER IN QUICK TURNAROUND TIMES’
pros: SKILLS DEVELOPMENT AND HIGH EMPHASIS ON INDIVIDUAL WELL BEING.CARE FROM MANAGEMENT TOWARDS ORDINARY STAFF
cons: VERY HIGH EXPECTATIONS AND PERFORMANCES

title: ‘Could have been better, but those responsible for providing opportunities simply and wrongly got in the way of genuine talent.’
pros: Some personnel are really good at what they do - however are often overridden with poor decisions.
cons: Career progression is at the mercy of poor management styles who service their own interests above those of their direct reports.

title: ‘If it wasn’t for the pay I’d be gone’
pros: Discounts off power and gas
cons:
Management 
Getting flexible working

title: ‘Great place to stay, if you have bonded with Senior Managers’
pros: Competence and competitiveness
cons: Especially in IT, some Middle/Senior managers remain self-centric and rather employ friends than allocate work on merit; competition is too often an offshoring IT Business partner, who is much cheaper

title: ‘Experience from a maintenance worker’
pros: Even time roster, with very High hourly salary!
cons: Difficult when dealing with management.

title: ‘Latest tech stack, fancy office, diverse culture’
pros:
They are on latest tech stack
Most apps are on cloud
New office
cons: I didn't find anything significant

title: ‘The reality doesn't match the promise’
pros: Flexible work environment, but depends on your manager.
cons: Senior leadership don't live the values, it isn't safe to speak up, the glossy purpose and values aren't the reality of how the organisation works.

title: ‘Great people, very good culture with good leadership and direction.’
pros: Good People and culture
cons: If the team is small growth opportunities can be restricted within the team. But can be accessed across the company.

title: ‘Great working environment’
pros: Great working environment
cons: Bureaucratic Management

title: ‘Awesome’
pros: Great culture, great people
cons: Keeping up with the pace of change

title: ‘Great for 6 to 9 months, not the long term! ’
pros: Great and friendly professionals at the operational level, very good infrastructure and support. Exposure to some of the best technology and field experts
cons: A very unstable environment with almost no real collaboration across different teams and political toxicity at higher levels which hinders any progress made at lower levels. Contractors and consultants basically run the place making stability and sustainability an issue.

title: ‘A good place to work at’
pros: The Work flexibility is fantastic and the Melbourne building is a great environment to work in.
cons: Management can be challenging and a bit heirarchial, depending on the area of the business

title: ‘Stability in career growth, and attention to mental health/diversity/inclusion needs more work’
pros: Great offices, and very positive high level and senior leadership
cons:
Lower to middle management were not and continue not to be trained/up skilled in both diversity and mental health conversations. Considering this is a big thing spoken about from a branding perspective, to the greater market and by the CEO of the company, the effort to engage appropriately as you make it down the chain is not representative of the perception.

Very limited career progression, particularly in parts of the business where there appears to be a level of isolation, and unwillingness to encourage internal attrition and growth.

The restructures! My god the restructures!! How do they restructure so frequently??

title: ‘I would recommend AGL to anyone.’
pros: Fantastic company to work for. Great environment, opportunities, and diversity. Loved every minute of working for AGL
cons: None it is a very supportive environment

title: ‘Terrible place for your mental health’
pros: The staff working there on the phones, they work hard, but that is it.
cons: Everything, the management SUCKS. They get paid large while doing jack all.

title: ‘Never again!’
pros: I didn't enjoy it
cons: Targets set were not achievable

title: ‘A lot of potential with little delivery due to politics’
pros: Steady job
cons: Restructuring

title: ‘The company is engaging to staff’
pros: The culture
cons: Management

title: ‘A good place to work but with little opportunities for career development and growth, with rampant politics and factionalism.’
pros: Company makes profits
cons: Culture

title: ‘Need more training’
pros: City location
cons: Targets

title: ‘Challenging to the young that dont know how to stand up for themselves’
pros: Nice coffee.
cons: If you were not part of the \"click\" you got no where.

title: ‘Horrible!’
pros: Nothing good about the company
cons: Toxic working environment with unfriendly management and staff

title: ‘Good exp’
pros: Good people and environment
cons: Energy mkt challenges

title: ‘Give it a miss’
‘Good for people starting families, who are looking for the big $, or are not necessarily fussed about culture.’
pros: The work life balance is good - particularly the ability to work from home with no judgement. I believe mat/paternity leave is very generous - though not relevant for me. You are able to salary sacrifice for shares and/or  additional paid leave.
cons: Culture is terrible. Very political and toxic. There are no skip-level meetings and micromanagement goes unnoticed.

title: ‘I would not go back there’
pros: The location was very convenient
cons: There was very little flexibility

title: ‘Good, but could be better.’
pros: Great location, facilities, staff engagement, pay and conditions.
cons: Work/life balance was an issue for me, but each employee would have to determine this for themselves individually.
